sen.j: 吉良氏（きら）は日本における武士の名家の一つであり、代表的なものに下の三つの流れがある。
sen.e: The Kira clan is one of the most prestigious samurai families in Japan; listed below are the three flows representative of this family.
The Kira clan is one of the most prestigious samurai families in Japan; listed below are this family's three notable lines of descent.
sen.cmt: Translating "流れ" as "flow" is just chokuyaku. The Kenkyusha Online Dictionary has the following entry for this word:4 〔血統〕 descent; 〔流派〕 a school. ●流れの末 a descendant. ●源氏の流れをくむ be descended from the Minamoto familyPlease keep in mind that the correct translation of a word depends on the context in which it is used.
sen.e: The Kira clan is one of the most prestigious samurai families in Japan; listed below are this family's three notable lines of descent.

sen.j: 清和源氏足利氏支族の吉良氏（長氏流）。
sen.e: The Kira clan (Osauji branch) which flows from the house of the Ashikaga family branch of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
The line of the Kira clan (Osauji branch) which is descended from the house of the Ashikaga family branch of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan):
The line of the Kira clan (Osauji branch) which is descended from the house of the Ashikaga family branch of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan):

sen.j: 三河吉良氏。
sen.e: The Mikawa-Kira clan
The Mikawa-Kira clan
The Mikawa-Kira clan

sen.j: 清和源氏足利氏支族の吉良氏（義継流）。
sen.e: The Kira clan (Yoshitsugu branch) which flows from the house of Ashikaga family branch of the Seiwa-Genji
The line of the Kira clan (Yoshitsugu branch) which is descended from the house of Ashikaga family branch of the Seiwa-Genji:
The line of the Kira clan (Yoshitsugu branch) which is descended from the house of Ashikaga family branch of the Seiwa-Genji:

sen.j: 奥州（武蔵）吉良氏。
sen.e: The Oshu (Musashi) Kira clan
OK
OK

sen.j: 清和源氏源為義流の吉良氏。
sen.e: The Kira clan which flows from MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
The line of the Kira clan which is descended from the MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi line of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan):
The line of the Kira clan which is descended from the MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi line of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan):

sen.j: 土佐吉良氏。
sen.e: The Tosa-Kira clan
The Tosa-Kira clan
The Tosa-Kira clan

sen.j: 清和源氏足利流吉良氏
sen.e: The Kira clan which flows from house of Ashikaga family branch of the Seiwa-Genji
The Kira clan of the Ashikaga lineage of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
sen.cmt: スムースに修正しました。
sen.e: The Kira clan of the Ashikaga lineage of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)

sen.j: 本姓は源氏。
sen.e: The real family name is Genji (Minamoto clan).
The original family name is Genji (Minamoto clan).
The original family name is Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 家系は清和源氏の一家系河内源氏の流れを汲む足利氏の一門である。
sen.e: The family was descended from the house of the Ashikaga family branch of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) this line flows from Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
The family line belongs to the Ashikaga clan, which is descended form the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), a branch family of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: The family line belongs to the Ashikaga clan, which is descended form the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), a branch family of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 足利義氏 (足利家3代目当主)の庶子長男 吉良長氏及びその弟 吉良義継より出る。
sen.e: The illegitimate eldest son of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the third head of ASHIKAGA family), Osauji KIRA, and his younger brother Yoshitsugu KIRA established the Kira clan.
The illegitimate eldest son of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the third family head of the Ashikaga clan), Osauji KIRA, and his younger brother Yoshitsugu KIRA established the Kira clan.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: The illegitimate eldest son of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the third family head of the Ashikaga clan), Osauji KIRA, and his younger brother Yoshitsugu KIRA established the Kira clan.

sen.j: 兄 長氏の家系は『三河吉良氏』となり、弟 義継の家系を『奥州吉良氏』という。
sen.e: The family of older brother, Osauji, became "The Mikawa-Kira clan," then the family of younger brother, Yoshitsugu, established the "The Oshu-Kira clan".
The family of older brother, Osauji, became "The Mikawa-Kira clan," then the family of younger brother, Yoshitsugu, established "The Oshu-Kira clan."
sen.cmt: the を削除しました。ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: The family of older brother, Osauji, became "The Mikawa-Kira clan," then the family of younger brother, Yoshitsugu, established "The Oshu-Kira clan."

sen.j: 吉良氏は足利一門において名門中の名門とされ、分家の今川家とともに足利将軍家の連枝としての家格を有した。
sen.e: The Kira clan is considered to be a most distinguished noble family among other prestigious Ashikaga clans, and The Kira clan held the family status as noble brothers to a prestigious nobleman, Ashikaga the Shogunate to the house of Imagawa, a branch of the The Kira Family.

The Kira clan was considered as the most distinguished noble family among the Ashikaga clan, and the Kira clan held the family status as Renshi (noble sibling) with the Imagawa family, a branch of the Kira family.
sen.cmt: is→was, to be a→as the,the を補いました。other prestigious Ashikaga clans→Ashikaga clan,The→the,The Kira Family→the Kira family と修正しました。文半ばを文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: The Kira clan was considered as the most distinguished noble family among the Ashikaga clan, and the Kira clan held the family status as Renshi (noble sibling) with the Imagawa family, a branch of the Kira family.

sen.j: その格式は「御所（足利将軍家）が絶えれば吉良が継ぎ、吉良が絶えれば今川が継ぐ」とまで言われた。
sen.e: Respective of their family status, people say, "If the Imperial Palace (Ashikaga family to inherit the shogunate) dies out, Kira inherits succession to the family headship, and then Imagawa inherits the formality when Kira dies out."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The status was even said as, "if the Imperial Palace (Ashikaga family to inherit the shogunate) dies out, the Kira inherits the succession to the family headship, and the Imagawa inherits the formality when Kira dies out."
sen.cmt: the を補いました。文最初部分を文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: The status was even said as, "if the Imperial Palace (Ashikaga family to inherit the shogunate) dies out, the Kira inherits the succession to the family headship, and the Imagawa inherits the formality when Kira dies out."

sen.j: 足利将軍家の血脈が絶えた際には足利宗家の家督を継承することが許されていた。
sen.e: This means that Kira and Imaga clans were allowed to succeed to the head the family of Ashikaga when the predecessor of family headship to the Ashikaga Shogunate family died out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This means that the Kira and the Imaga clans were allowed to succeed the family estate of the head family of Ashikaga, if the lineage of the Ashikaga Shogunate family died out.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。to, カンマを補いました。「足利宗家の家督」の部分を修正しました。when→if,predecessor of family headship to→lineage of と修正しました。
sen.e: This means that the Kira and the Imaga clans were allowed to succeed the family estate of the head family of Ashikaga, if the lineage of the Ashikaga Shogunate family died out.

sen.j: ただ、三河でも奥州でも家格の高さに武力が伴わず、家運は低迷。
sen.e: However, the high family status was not conjoined with military power in either the Mikawa or Oshu clans and the house luck was sluggish.
However, the high family status was not conjoined with the military power in both the Mikawa and the Oshu clans, and their family fortunes were dull.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。either or→both and,「家運は低迷」を修正しました。
sen.e: However, the high family status was not conjoined with the military power in both the Mikawa and the Oshu clans, and their family fortunes were dull.

sen.j: 大名としての存続は断たれた。
sen.e: The Mikawa and Oshu families would not continue to maintain their status as a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord).
The continuance of them as daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) was ended.
sen.cmt: よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: The continuance of them as daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) was ended.

sen.j: しかし両系統は江戸時代に家名を繋いでいる。
sen.e: However, branches of these two family clans passed on their family name into the Edo period.
However, these two lines succeeded to retrieve the family names in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。（”家名を取り戻した”という意味で修正しました）
sen.e: However, these two lines succeeded to retrieve the family names in the Edo period.

sen.j: （それぞれの家系については、以下に詳述）
sen.e: (The status of each family will be explained in detail below.)
(For each family lines, will be explained in detail below.)
sen.cmt: The status of each family →For each family lines と修正しました。
sen.e: (For each family lines, will be explained in detail below.)

sen.j: 三河吉良氏
sen.e: Mikawa-Kira clan
Mikawa-Kira clan
Mikawa-Kira clan

tit.cmt: カッコ部分を削除しました。

sen.j: 13世紀の頃、足利義氏 (足利家3代目当主)の長男・長氏が三河国碧海郡吉良荘（現・愛知県西尾市・幡豆郡）を本拠としたのを契機に、「吉良」を名乗りとしたことに始まる。
sen.e: Around the 13th century, the eldest son of the Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the third head of ASHIKAGA family), Osauji established his residency in Kiranosho, Aomi County, Mikawa Province (presently, Nishio City and Hazu County, Aichi Prefecture) as his home ground, then commenced calling himself, "Kira."

It originated from around the13th century, the first son of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the third family head of the Ashikaga family), Osauji established his home base in Kiranosho, Aomi County, Mikawa Province (present Nishio City and Hazu County, Aichi Prefecture), then commenced calling himself, 'Kira.'
sen.cmt: It originated from を補いました。13th,eldest→first, スペースの修正、カッコ内の修正をしました。residency→home base,presently,→present,引用符を修正しました。the, as his home ground を削除しました。
sen.e: It originated from around the13th century, the first son of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the third family head of the Ashikaga family), Osauji established his home base in Kiranosho, Aomi County, Mikawa Province (present Nishio City and Hazu County, Aichi Prefecture), then commenced calling himself, 'Kira.'

sen.j: 当時の吉良荘は古矢作川の東西にも広がっていたため、川の東西をそれぞれ「東条」（城は現幡豆郡吉良町大字駮馬〈まだらめ〉字城山）・「西条」（城は現西尾市）と区分して呼んでいた。
sen.e: In those days, Kiranosho reached out to the east and the west of the old Yahagi River, so it was sorted out that the east and west of the river, and the buildings therein were to be called "Tojo" (The castle exists in Shiroyama, Madarame, Kira-cho, Hazu County) and "Saijo" (The castle presently exists in Nishio city).

In those days, Kiranosho reached out to the east and the west of the Furuyahagi-gawa River, so it was divided into two as the west and the east, and called, 'Tojo' (The castle exists in Shiroyama, Madarame, Kira-cho, Hazu County) and 'Saijo' (The castle presently exists in Nishio City).
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。「古矢作川」を修正しました。「それぞれ区別して呼んでいた」という部分を修正しました。引用符を修正しました。city→City と修正しました。
sen.e: In those days, Kiranosho reached out to the east and the west of the Furuyahagi-gawa River, so it was divided into two as the west and the east, and called, 'Tojo' (The castle exists in Shiroyama, Madarame, Kira-cho, Hazu County) and 'Saijo' (The castle presently exists in Nishio City).

sen.j: 長氏が拠ったのは、この西条の方であり、以降しばらくこの系統は西条吉良氏と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Osauji established his base residency in Saijo, and from that point until some late time his family line would be known as the Saijokira clan.
Osauji based himself in Saijo, and for a while after that, his family line was called the Saijokira clan.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Osauji based himself in Saijo, and for a while after that, his family line was called the Saijokira clan.

sen.j: なお、この三河国吉良荘の吉良の語源は、荘園内に雲母（大和言葉で「きらら」）の鉱山を古くから有したためにつけられたものと言われている。
sen.e: Additionally, the origins of the kira prefex in Kiranosho of Mikawa Province seem to derive from the word "kirara" (in yamato-kotoba which literally translates the meaning of a native Japanese word) which is mica; there has been a continuous mica mining operation in the mountainous property since the ancient age.

Additionally, the origin of the word of kira as Kiranosho of Mikawa Province, is said to be derived from the word 'kirara' (in yamato-kotoba [words of Japanese origi]) which is mica, since the clan had a mica mine within its shoen from long time ago.
sen.cmt: 「語源」の部分を修正しました。引用符を修正しました。「大和言葉」の部分を修正しました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Additionally, the origin of the word of kira as Kiranosho of Mikawa Province, is said to be derived from the word 'kirara' (in yamato-kotoba [words of Japanese origi]) which is mica, since the clan had a mica mine within its shoen from long time ago.

sen.j: 承久の乱以降、足利氏は三河国内に多くの所領を得たが、長氏の吉良氏はその中でも総指揮・監督権を委ねられる立場にある。
sen.e: After the Jokyu War, the Ashikaga clan reciieved much of the shoryo (territory) inside Mikawa Province, but the Osauji line of the Kira clan was advocating for their position as appointee to supreme command with rights of total operational conduct.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the Jokyu War, the Ashikaga clan received much of the shoryo (territory) within Mikawa Province, but Osauji of the Kira clan was the position to be entrusted as the supreme commander and the supervisor among them.
sen.cmt: reciieved→received, inside→within,文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: After the Jokyu War, the Ashikaga clan received much of the shoryo (territory) within Mikawa Province, but Osauji of the Kira clan was the position to be entrusted as the supreme commander and the supervisor among them.

sen.j: 足利宗家から深い信頼を受けていたことがわかる。
sen.e: This was an acknowledgement to the Kira clan of the deep trust received from the head family Ashikaga.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It shows that the Kira clan was receiving the deep trust from the head family of Ashikaga.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: It shows that the Kira clan was receiving the deep trust from the head family of Ashikaga.

sen.j: 後代、渋川氏・石橋氏の両家とともに「御一家」と称されて別格の扱いを受けた。
sen.e: Based upon this background in posterity, both families, the Shibukawa clan and Ishibashi clan were to be called "goikke" (head and branch family of Ashikaga) therefore to receive exceptional treatment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Based upon this background in posterity, both families, the Shibukawa clan and the Ishibashi clan were called 'goikke' (head and branch family of Ashikaga), and received exceptional treatment.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。 to be を削除しました。 引用符の修正、therefore to receive→and received と修正しました。
sen.e: Based upon this background in posterity, both families, the Shibukawa clan and the Ishibashi clan were called 'goikke' (head and branch family of Ashikaga), and received exceptional treatment.

sen.j: 「御所が絶えれば吉良が継ぎ、吉良が絶えれば今川が継ぐ」という序列観が人々の間に定着したのも、こうした背景があってのことであった。
sen.e: This would establish for the all people concerned the ideas of succession, "Kira inherited if the Imperial Palace died out, and Imagawa inherited if Kira died out", to curtal a gnarled assumption in a contested hierarchical succession order.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Establishing the hierarchy as "if the Imperial Palace dies out, the Kira inherits the succession to the family headship, and the Imagawa inherits when Kira dies out" among the people, is due to this background.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Establishing the hierarchy as "if the Imperial Palace dies out, the Kira inherits the succession to the family headship, and the Imagawa inherits when Kira dies out" among the people, is due to this background.

sen.j: しかし実際には、足利将軍家には鎌倉公方、古河公方、堀越公方などの別家が多くあり、吉良氏が足利本家を継げる可能性は低かった。
sen.e: However, the possibility remained low for the Kira clan to be a viable successor as head of the family of Ashikaga since there were many bekke (branch family) families in Ashikaga Shogun family; Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region), Kgakubo (descendants of one of the Ashikaga families that held the office of the Kanto district administrator), and Horigoe Kubo.

However, the possibility remained low for the Kira clan to be a successor of the head family of the Ashikaga clan, since there were many bekke (branch family) families in the Ashikaga Shogun family; the Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region), the Kogakubo (descendants of one of the Ashikaga families that held the office of the Kanto district administrator), and the Horigoe Kubo.
sen.cmt: viable successor as head of the family of Ashikaga→successor of the head family of the Ashikaga clan と修正しました。Kgakubo→Kogakubo,the を補いました。
sen.e: However, the possibility remained low for the Kira clan to be a successor of the head family of the Ashikaga clan, since there were many bekke (branch family) families in the Ashikaga Shogun family; the Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region), the Kogakubo (descendants of one of the Ashikaga families that held the office of the Kanto district administrator), and the Horigoe Kubo.

sen.j: 長氏の子満氏は霜月騒動で安達泰盛に与し、北条氏による討伐を受けて戦死。
sen.e: Mituuji a child of Osauji, positioned himself on the Yasumori ADACHI side during the Shimotsuki Sodo (a political change to the Kamakura Bakufu), subsequently Mituuji was killed in an act of subjugation by order of the Hojo clan

Mituuji, a child of Osauji, took the side of Yasumori ADACHI during the Shimotsuki Sodo (a political change to the Kamakura Bakufu), subsequently Mituuji was subdued and killed by the order of the Hojo clan
sen.cmt: カンマ、ピリオドを補いました。よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: Mituuji, a child of Osauji, took the side of Yasumori ADACHI during the Shimotsuki Sodo (a political change to the Kamakura Bakufu), subsequently Mituuji was subdued and killed by the order of the Hojo clan

sen.j: その子貞義は元弘3年（1333年）、後醍醐天皇方の勢力討滅の命を帯びて上洛途上の足利尊氏が三河国に逗留した際、貞義は「天皇について鎌倉幕府打倒のために立ち上がるべきである」と強硬に進言。
sen.e: In 1333, Takauji ASHIKAGA represented the Emperor Godaigo in a mission on destroying power to the Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1333, Sadayoshi, child of Mitsuuji strongly proposed Takauji ASHIKAGA, who was sojourning in Mikawa Province on the way the Kyoto, on the mission destroying the power of the Emperor Godaigo's side, 'be the side of the Emperor, and stand up for defeating the Kamakura bakufu.'
sen.cmt: 分割してありましたが、ウェブと照らし合わせてみても一文での訳が適していると判断し、後列と一括し、修正しました。
sen.e: In 1333, Sadayoshi, child of Mitsuuji strongly proposed Takauji ASHIKAGA, who was sojourning in Mikawa Province on the way the Kyoto, on the mission destroying the power of the Emperor Godaigo's side, 'be the side of the Emperor, and stand up for defeating the Kamakura bakufu.'

sen.j: これが最終的な引き鉄となって高氏は六波羅探題攻撃に踏み切り、鎌倉幕府崩壊劇の嚆矢となった。
sen.e: This became the final cause, and the Kou clan decided to attack Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) marking the inception of koshi (the beginning) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) collapse drama.

This became the final cause, and Takauji decided to attack Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto), which was the beginning of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) collapsing drama.
sen.cmt: the Kou clan→Takauji （ウェブで確認）カンマを挿入しました。「嚆矢」はここでは英訳のままにしました。collapse→collapsing と修正しました。
sen.e: This became the final cause, and Takauji decided to attack Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto), which was the beginning of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) collapsing drama.

sen.j: 南北朝時代_(日本)から室町時代
sen.e: Through the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the Muromachi period
From the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the Muromachi period
sen.cmt: Through→From the period of と修正しました。
sen.e: From the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the Muromachi period

sen.j: 貞義の子満義は観応の擾乱で足利直義に与した。
sen.e: A child of Sadayosh, Mitsuyoshi took part in behalf of the Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA side during the Kanno disturbance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: A child of Sadayosh, Mitsuyoshi took the side the Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA during the Kanno disturbance.
sen.cmt: disturbance→Disturbance,よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: A child of Sadayosh, Mitsuyoshi took the side the Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA during the Kanno disturbance.

sen.j: 嫡男満貞とともに各地を転戦、一時的に南朝 (日本)にも帰順した後、最終的に室町幕府に降る。
sen.e: Sadauosh battled in one place after other and in locations with Mitusada who was his legitimate son, Sadayosh and his son briefly returned to their former allegiance with the Southern Court, finally surrendering to Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Mitsuyoshi moved from place to place to fight with Mitusada who was his legitimate son, they also obeyed the Southern Court (Japan) for a while, then finally surrendered to the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: ここでは貞義ではなく満義と理解し、修正しました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Mitsuyoshi moved from place to place to fight with Mitusada who was his legitimate son, they also obeyed the Southern Court (Japan) for a while, then finally surrendered to the Muromachi bakufu.

sen.j: 吉良氏初代 長氏の隠居所として築かれた館は「丸山御所」と称された。
sen.e: The first generation of Kira clan, Osauji, built a palace retreat called "maruyama-gosho" to be used as a retreat during his mature years.
The first generation of Kira clan, Osauji, built a retreat for his old age called 'Maruyama-gosho.'
sen.cmt: 「隠居所」の部分を修正しました。maruyama→Maruyama,引用符を修正しました。
sen.e: The first generation of Kira clan, Osauji, built a retreat for his old age called 'Maruyama-gosho.'

sen.j: しかし、吉良氏自体は京都にあって将軍家の近臣として仕える他は三河や武蔵にあって守護職を世襲することもなく実質的には小領主としての勢力しか持たなかった。
sen.e: However, the Kira clan remained in Kyoto and was restricted to only serve as a trusted vassal of Shogun family, the clan did not inherit the shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) in Mikawa Province, nor Musashi Province and their real power was limited to that of a small feudal lord.

However, besides the Kira clan remained in Kyoto and served as a trusted vassal of the shogun family, the clan did not inherit the shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) in Mikawa Province, or Musashi Province, their substantial power was limited to that of a small feudal lord.
sen.cmt: besides を補いました。 was restricted to only を削除しました。serve→served,Shogun family→the shogun family,nor→or,real→substantial と修正しました。
sen.e: However, besides the Kira clan remained in Kyoto and served as a trusted vassal of the shogun family, the clan did not inherit the shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) in Mikawa Province, or Musashi Province, their substantial power was limited to that of a small feudal lord.

sen.j: 満義・満貞父子が本拠地の吉良荘を留守にしている間に、満義の四男尊義が吉良荘の東条を押領し、東条吉良氏として自立するという事件が起きる。
sen.e: While Mitsuyoshi and Mitsusada, father and son, were away from the home ground in Kiranosho in Mikawa Province, an incident happened; Takayoshi who was the fourth son of Mitsuyoshi siezed the Tojo of Kiranosho, an act in the processs to become the independent Tojokira clan.

While Mitsuyoshi and Mitsusada, father and son, were away from the home ground in Kiranosho in Mikawa Province, an incident happened; Takayoshi who was the fourth son of Mitsuyoshi embezzled the Tojo of Kiranosho, then became independent as the Tojokira clan.
sen.cmt: siezed→embezzled と修正しました。「東条吉良氏として自立する」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: While Mitsuyoshi and Mitsusada, father and son, were away from the home ground in Kiranosho in Mikawa Province, an incident happened; Takayoshi who was the fourth son of Mitsuyoshi embezzled the Tojo of Kiranosho, then became independent as the Tojokira clan.

sen.j: 以降尊義の東条吉良氏と、西条に勢力を限定された満貞の西条吉良氏とは、互いに正統性を主張しあって譲らず、両者の子孫が約一世紀に渡って三河一国を舞台に抗争を繰り広げた。
sen.e: After this incident, the Takayoshi's family line of the Tojokira clan and the Saijokira clan, which had limited power over the Saijo, persisted on the legitimacy their respective clans, establishing for their future descendants a rivalry staged upon the Mikawa Province for over one century.

After this incident, the Takayoshi's family line of the Tojokira clan and the Saijokira clan, which had limited power over the Saijo, persisted on the legitimacy of their respective clans, the conflict continued for over a century staged upon Mikawa Province between the descendents of the two.
sen.cmt: of を補いました。文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: After this incident, the Takayoshi's family line of the Tojokira clan and the Saijokira clan, which had limited power over the Saijo, persisted on the legitimacy of their respective clans, the conflict continued for over a century staged upon Mikawa Province between the descendents of the two.

sen.j: 応仁の乱においては西条家の義貞が東軍、東条家の義藤が西軍にそれぞれ属して戦っている。
sen.e: During the Onin war, both families participated in battle; Yoshisada of the Saijo family belonged to East squad, and Yoshifuji of Tojo the family belonged to West squad.

sen.e: During the Onin war, both families participated in the battle; Yoshisada of the Saijo family belonged to the East squad, and Yoshifuji of Tojo the family belonged to the West squad.
During the Onin war, both families participated in the battle; Yoshisada of the Saijo family belonged to the East squad, and Yoshifuji of Tojo the family belonged to the West squad.

sen.j: （なお、吉良氏発祥当時に区分された定義（2.の義継流吉良氏が東条吉良氏、1.の長氏流吉良氏が西条吉良氏を称した点）とは、別物。

Kira clan of Osauji lineage referred to themselves as the Saijokira clan; 2. Kira clan of Yoshitsugu lineage referred to themselves as the Tojokira clan.

sen.j: ここでいう東条・西条吉良氏とは区別が必要である）。

sen.j: 戦国時代_(日本)

The Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States)
sen.cmt: 用語統一に従い修正しました。

sen.j: 三河吉良氏は勢力の振るわない上に、西条吉良氏と東条吉良氏に分裂した内部抗争を収束させなかった。
sen.e: The power of the Mikawa-Kira clan could not settle disputes caused by the internal clash division of the Saijokira clan from Tojokira clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As well as its dull influence, the Mikawa-Kira clan could not settle the internal dispute between the Saijokira clan and the Tojokira clan.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: As well as its dull influence, the Mikawa-Kira clan could not settle the internal dispute between the Saijokira clan and the Tojokira clan.

sen.j: 為、家運を一段と低迷させていた。
sen.e: The effect on the Mikawa-Kira clan was a remarkable reduction upon the families luck.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, its family fortunes deteriorated remarkably.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, its family fortunes deteriorated remarkably.

sen.j: その間に、庶流である駿河国守護 今川氏からの圧迫を受けたのである。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the Mikawa-Kira clan received pressure from the Suruga no kuni shugo (a provincial constable of Suruga Province), family branch of the Imagawa clan.
During that time, the Mikawa-Kira clan received pressure from the Imagawa clan, who was a branch family and the shugo (a provincial constable of Suruga Province) of Suruga Province.
sen.cmt: Meanwhile→During that time,「駿河国」、オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: During that time, the Mikawa-Kira clan received pressure from the Imagawa clan, who was a branch family and the shugo (a provincial constable of Suruga Province) of Suruga Province.

sen.j: 西条吉良の義尭の頃であり、遠江国の拠点である引間荘を奪われている。
sen.e: During the time period of Yoshitaka of Saijokira, Saijokira lost Hikumanosho which was their home ground in Totomi Province.
It was around the era of Yoshitaka of Saijokira, Saijokira lost Hikumanosho which was their home ground in Totomi Province.
sen.cmt: 「の頃」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: It was around the era of Yoshitaka of Saijokira, Saijokira lost Hikumanosho which was their home ground in Totomi Province.

sen.j: この期に及んでようやく同族抗争の愚を悟った東条・西条両家は、東条吉良の持広が西条吉良の吉良義安を養嗣子にするという形で和議を成立させ、長年の抗争に終止符を打った。
sen.e: At the last moment, Saijokira and Tojokira finally realized the foolishness of their internal tribal rivalry.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Reaching this far, the Saijokira and the Tojokira of both families finally realized the foolishness of their internal tribal rivalry, made Mochihiro of the Tojokira clan to adopt Yoshiyasu of the Saijokira clan as heir to establish peace, then ended the longtime rivalry.
sen.cmt: ウェブ上のものと照らし合わせてみた上で、この場合は一括の方が意味が通りやすいと判断し、一括とし、修正しました。重複する部分の後列のオリジナルは削除しました。
sen.e: Reaching this far, the Saijokira and the Tojokira of both families finally realized the foolishness of their internal tribal rivalry, made Mochihiro of the Tojokira clan to adopt Yoshiyasu of the Saijokira clan as heir to establish peace, then ended the longtime rivalry.

sen.j: 享禄・天文 (元号)初年間のことである。
sen.e: It was from the Kyoroku era (1528 to1531) to the first year of Tenbun era (1532-1555).
It was the beginning of the Kyoroku era (1528 to1531) and the Tenbun era (1532-1555).
sen.cmt: 「初年間」をbeginning として修正しました。
sen.e: It was the beginning of the Kyoroku era (1528 to1531) and the Tenbun era (1532-1555).

sen.j: 義安は今川氏への対抗上、同じく今川氏と抗争中にあった尾張国の織田氏に加担し、防衛体制を整えていく。
sen.e: Because Yasushi opposed the Imagawa clan, Yasushi supported the Oda clan in Owari Province, fixing a defense system dispute with respect to the Imagawa clan issues.
Because of its opposition to the Imagawa clan, Yoshiyasu supported the Oda clan in Owari Province who was also resisting the Imagawa clan, then started to maintain the defense system.
sen.cmt: Yasushi→Yoshiyasu,文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Because of its opposition to the Imagawa clan, Yoshiyasu supported the Oda clan in Owari Province who was also resisting the Imagawa clan, then started to maintain the defense system.

sen.j: しかし、長年の抗争で衰退させた家運の回復までには至らず、天文18年（1549年）に今川義元の猛攻に敗退。
sen.e: However, Yoshiyasu was unable recover or reverse the declining family luck affected by longtime rivalries, and was subsequently defeated during the violent attack of Yoshimoto IMAGAWA in 1549.
However, it was not enough to recover the family fortunes which was decayed by the longtime rivalries, and was subsequently defeated by the fierce attack of Yoshimoto IMAGAWA in 1549.
sen.cmt: よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: However, it was not enough to recover the family fortunes which was decayed by the longtime rivalries, and was subsequently defeated by the fierce attack of Yoshimoto IMAGAWA in 1549.

sen.j: 捕らえられた義安の身柄は駿河に抑留された。
sen.e: Yoshiyasu was captured then detained in Suruga.
Yoshiyasu was captured then detained in Suruga.
Yoshiyasu was captured then detained in Suruga.

sen.j: その後の吉良氏は、後継に西条から義安の実弟義昭が今川氏によって捩じ込まれ、家名存続を許された。
sen.e: Imagawa of the succeeding Kira clan forced Yoshiaki who was Yoshiyasu's younger biological brother from the Saijo Kira clan and into the Yoshiyasu line of the Kira family; Imagawa then appointed Yoshiaki as successor to maintain the family name.

The Kira clan afterward, Yoshiaki, who was Yoshiyasu's biological younger brother from the Saijo Kira clan was pushed in as the successor by the Imagawa clan, then allowed to continue the family name.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: The Kira clan afterward, Yoshiaki, who was Yoshiyasu's biological younger brother from the Saijo Kira clan was pushed in as the successor by the Imagawa clan, then allowed to continue the family name.

sen.j: すなわち独立領主としての吉良氏ではなく、今川義元への隷属を強いられた訳である。
sen.e: In other words the Kira clan did not exist as an independent feudal lord, but they were made subordinate toYoshimoto IMAGAWA.
In other words, this did not mean the Kira clan as an independent feudal lord, but the Kira clan was forced to obey Yoshimoto IMAGAWA.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: In other words, this did not mean the Kira clan as an independent feudal lord, but the Kira clan was forced to obey Yoshimoto IMAGAWA.

sen.j: ところが、桶狭間の合戦で義元が討ち取られた後は、今川氏も徐々に衰退してしまう。
sen.e: However the Imagawa clans' power gradually declined after Yoshimoto was killed at the Battle of Okehazama.
However, the Imagawa clan's power gradually declined after Yoshimoto was killed at the Battle of Okehazama.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。clans'→clan's と修正しました。
sen.e: However, the Imagawa clan's power gradually declined after Yoshimoto was killed at the Battle of Okehazama.

sen.j: 吉良氏は三河国の支配を目指す徳川家康と対立。
sen.e: The Kira clan was opposed to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who was positioning himself for rule of the Mikawa Province.
The Kira clan opposed to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who was aiming to become the ruler of Mikawa Province.
sen.cmt: was opposed→opposed,「三河国の支配を目指す」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: The Kira clan opposed to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who was aiming to become the ruler of Mikawa Province.

sen.j: 善明堤の戦いや藤波畷の戦いを経て、家康に降伏する。
sen.e: After participating in the battles of Zenmyo-tsutsumi and Fujinami-nawate, the Kira clan surrendered to Ieyasu.
After participating in the battles of Zenmyo-tsutsumi and Fujinami-nawate, the Kira clan surrendered to Ieyasu.
After participating in the battles of Zenmyo-tsutsumi and Fujinami-nawate, the Kira clan surrendered to Ieyasu.

sen.j: その後、三河一向一揆が勃発すると一向一揆方に加担して、再び家康と戦った。
sen.e: Afterwards, during the Mikawa Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers in Mikawa Province) break out, the Kira clan took part in the uprisings' riot and again fought against Ieyasu.
After that, when the Mikawa Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers in Mikawa Province) broke out, the Kira clan took part in the uprising riot, and again fought against Ieyasu.
sen.cmt: Afterwards→After that,during→when,break→broke,カンマを補い、uprisings'→uprising と修正しました。
sen.e: After that, when the Mikawa Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers in Mikawa Province) broke out, the Kira clan took part in the uprising riot, and again fought against Ieyasu.

sen.j: しかし、一揆方は家康に敗れ、吉良氏の家運衰退に拍車がかかることになった。
sen.e: However, the rioting side was defeated by Ieyasu, and the Kira family clan's luck declined at an accelerated pace.
However, the rioting side was defeated by Ieyasu, and the Kira clan's fortune declined at an accelerated pace.
sen.cmt: family clan's luck→clan's fortunes と修正しました。
sen.e: However, the rioting side was defeated by Ieyasu, and the Kira clan's fortune declined at an accelerated pace.

sen.j: これほど家運も振るわず困窮していながら、足利一門における名族中の名族たる誇りだけは強かった。
sen.e: Since, the Kira clan was affected by a negative opportunity to the fortune of family luck they struggled financially, affecting the high pride of a famous noble family in the Ashikaga clan.
Although its fortunes was dull and struggled financially, the Kira clan still had a high pride as the most noted family in the Ashikaga clan.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Although its fortunes was dull and struggled financially, the Kira clan still had a high pride as the most noted family in the Ashikaga clan.

sen.j: 織田信長の周旋により、尾張守護の斯波氏及びその一門 石橋氏と同盟を結ぶまでに漕ぎ着けた。
sen.e: With a recommendation by Nobunaga ODA, the Kira clan managed to reach making an alliance with the Shiba clan as a guard of Owari and their family, the Ishibashi clan.
With a mediation of Nobunaga ODA, the Kira clan managed to reach making an alliance with the Shiba clan, Shugo(provincial constables) of Owari Province, and its branch family, the Ishibashi clan.
sen.cmt: recommendation by→mediation of,「尾張守護」の部分を修正しました。 their→its と修正し、 branch,カンマを補いました。
sen.e: With a mediation of Nobunaga ODA, the Kira clan managed to reach making an alliance with the Shiba clan, Shugo(provincial constables) of Owari Province, and its branch family, the Ishibashi clan.

sen.j: ところが、斯波義銀と席次を巡る争いを起こしている。
sen.e: However, the Kira clan initiated a fight due to a disagreement on seating order with Yoshikane SHIBA.
However, the Kira clan caused a fight due to a disagreement on seating order with Yoshikane SHIBA.
However, the Kira clan caused a fight due to a disagreement on seating order with Yoshikane SHIBA.

sen.j: 斯波氏もまた、足利将軍家一門中将軍家や吉良氏に並ぶ名族であった。
sen.e: The Shiba clan, a famous noble family among the Ashikaga Shogunate family, was of equal high ranking among the Shogun family and Kira clan.
The Shiba clan, was also a noble family among the Ashikaga Shogunate family, equal to those, the Shogun family and the Kira clan.
sen.cmt: よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: The Shiba clan, was also a noble family among the Ashikaga Shogunate family, equal to those, the Shogun family and the Kira clan.

sen.j: 江戸時代
sen.e: Edo period (1603 - 1867)
Edo period
sen.cmt: カッコ部分を削除しました。
sen.e: Edo period

sen.j: 義安の子義定が松平清康の妹を母としていた関係で徳川氏に取り立てられた。
sen.e: A child of Yoshiyasu, Yoshisada, was appointed to the Tokugawa clan through relationship with his mother, since she was a sister of Kiyoyasu MATSUDAIR.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: A child of Yoshiyasu, Yoshisada, was promoted by the Tokugawa clan, due to that his mother was the younger sister of Kiyoyasu MATSUDAIRA.
sen.cmt: appointed to→promoted by,MATSUDAIR→MATSUDAIRA,よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: A child of Yoshiyasu, Yoshisada, was promoted by the Tokugawa clan, due to that his mother was the younger sister of Kiyoyasu MATSUDAIRA.

sen.j: その子義弥の代に至り旧吉良荘内で3000石を領して、高家筆頭の家格を付与された。
sen.e: Yoshishada's child Yoshimitsu, during his generation received the master of "ko-ke" (shogunate official in charge of advising kyo-o-yaku in taking care of envoys) status provided with the property of 541.17 cubic meters in Kiranosho, Mikawa Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the generation of Yoshishada's child Yoshimitsu, received the master of "ko-ke" (shogunate official in charge of advising kyo-o-yaku in taking care of envoys) status provided with 3,000 koku in former Kiranosho.
sen.cmt: 3000石は3,000 koku としました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: In the generation of Yoshishada's child Yoshimitsu, received the master of "ko-ke" (shogunate official in charge of advising kyo-o-yaku in taking care of envoys) status provided with 3,000 koku in former Kiranosho.

sen.j: これ以降の吉良氏は江戸幕府の儀典関係を取り仕切る家として存続する。
sen.e: Since then, the Kira clan continued as family managing rules of court protocol of Edo bakufu.
Thereafter, the Kira clan continued as a family managing the protocol of Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: Since then→Thereafter,court protocol→protocol,文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Thereafter, the Kira clan continued as a family managing the protocol of Edo bakufu.

sen.j: 義弥の孫義央が、儀典の指導に関して浅野長矩との間に確執を生じ、元禄赤穂事件に発展したことはよく知られている。
sen.e: Yoshinaka, a grandson of Yoshimitsu, produced discord within Naganori ASANO regarding the guidance of rules of court protocol, and it developed into the well known Genroku Ako Incident.
It is well known that, Yoshinaka, a grandson of Yoshimitsu, caused a discord with Naganori ASANO regarding the guidance of the protocol, and it developed into the Genroku Ako Incident.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: It is well known that, Yoshinaka, a grandson of Yoshimitsu, caused a discord with Naganori ASANO regarding the guidance of the protocol, and it developed into the Genroku Ako Incident.

sen.j: 同事件においては隠居していた前当主義央が殺害されたばかりか、騒動の責任を問われてた、嫡孫の当主義周は、改易の憂き目にあった。
sen.e: In this incidence, not only the former head of the household of Yoshinaka who had retired was killed, but also punished the present head of the household of Yoshimasa;Yoshimasa was a legitimate grandchild of and was asked to take responsibility for the disturbance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In this incidence, not only the former head of the household of Yoshinaka who had been retired was killed, but also Yoshimasa, the family head, had a hard time receiving the punishment of Kaieki (forfeit to rank of Samurai and properties), as asked to take responsibility for the disturbance.
sen.cmt: ウェブ上のものと照らし合わせてみた上で、この場合は一括の方が意味が通りやすいと判断し、一括とし、修正しました。重複する部分の後列のオリジナルは削除しました。
sen.e: In this incidence, not only the former head of the household of Yoshinaka who had been retired was killed, but also Yoshimasa, the family head, had a hard time receiving the punishment of Kaieki (forfeit to rank of Samurai and properties), as asked to take responsibility for the disturbance.

sen.j: 降って享保17年（1732年）、義央の弟の孫に当たる吉良義孚が東條家から吉良家への復姓を幕府に願い出て許されている。
sen.e: Later, in 1732 Yoshizane, a grandson of Yoshinaka's younger brother, asked the Edo bakufu in an application for restoration of all family names from the Tojiyo family to the Kira family, and was permitted to do so.

Later, in 1732, Yoshizane, a grandson of Yoshinaka's younger brother, asked the Edo bakufu for the permission to have its former name back, from the Tojo family to the Kira family, and was permitted to do so.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。文半ばを文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Later, in 1732, Yoshizane, a grandson of Yoshinaka's younger brother, asked the Edo bakufu for the permission to have its former name back, from the Tojo family to the Kira family, and was permitted to do so.

sen.j: 本姓は源氏。
sen.e: The real family name is Genji (Minamoto clan).
The original family name is Genji (Minamoto clan).
The original family name is Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 前項の吉良氏の同系。
sen.e: It has the same family roots as the previous section of the Kira clan.
The same line as the Kira clan in the previous section.
sen.cmt: スムースに修正しました。
sen.e: The same line as the Kira clan in the previous section.

sen.j: 足利義氏の四男・義継が、兄長氏と同じく三河国吉良荘を本拠とし、「吉良」を名乗りとしたことに始まる。
sen.e: In same way as the older Osauji, Yoshitsugu, the fourth son of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA, established his residency at Kiranosho in Mikawa Province; this became Yoshitsugu's home ground, and then he commenced calling himself, "Kira."

it originated from when, the fourth son of the Ashikaga clan Yoshitugu settled his home base at Kiranosho in Mikawa Province, the same as his older brother Osauji, and then he commenced calling himself, 'Kira.'
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: it originated from when, the fourth son of the Ashikaga clan Yoshitugu settled his home base at Kiranosho in Mikawa Province, the same as his older brother Osauji, and then he commenced calling himself, 'Kira.'

sen.j: 長氏が同荘西条に拠ったのに対して義継は東条を領し、東条吉良氏とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: As Osauji established his base residency in Saijo, Yoshitsugu established his residency in Tojo, then to be called the Tojokira clan.
As Osauji was based in Saijo of Kiranosho, Yoshitsugu owned Tojo, then called the Tojokira clan.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: As Osauji was based in Saijo of Kiranosho, Yoshitsugu owned Tojo, then called the Tojokira clan.

sen.j: 東条の城は東条城で、場所は現在の幡豆郡吉良町大字駮馬（まだらめ）字城山である。
sen.e: Tojo's resided in Tojo-jo Castle, it was located in present day Shiroyama, Madarame, Kira-cho, Hazu County.
The residence in Tojo was Tojo-jo Castle, it was located in present day Shiroyama, Madarame, Kira-cho, Hazu County.
sen.cmt: 「東条の城は東条城で」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: The residence in Tojo was Tojo-jo Castle, it was located in present day Shiroyama, Madarame, Kira-cho, Hazu County.

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)時代
sen.e: The period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) (1336-1392)
The period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan)
sen.cmt: 年代のカッコ部分は削除しました。
sen.e: The period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan)

sen.j: 貞家が成良親王の廂番から奥州管領（奥州探題の前身）にまで出世し、陸奥国多賀城に拠って足利政権の奥州統治の要となる。
sen.e: Sadaie succeeds in life to Oshu Kanrei (shogunate deputy of the northern regions. And this was the former position of the Oshu Tandai who supervised for the civil government and military affairs in Mutsu Province.) from hisashi ban (a person who keeps the night watch staying under the eaves of building) of Imperial Prince Nariyoshi to settle in Taga-jo Castle of Mutsu Province as an important person to pursue the Oshu rule of the Ashikaga Administration.

Sadaie was promoted to Oshu Kanrei (shogunate deputy of the northern regions [the former position of the Oshu Tandai who supervised for the civil government and military affairs in Mutsu Province]) from hisashi ban (a person who keeps the night watch staying under the eaves of building) of Imperial Prince Nariyoshi, and settled in Taga-jo Castle in Mutsu Province then became the key person for the Oshu rule of the Ashikaga Administration.
sen.cmt: ピリオドで区切られているカッコ内を修正しました。文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Sadaie was promoted to Oshu Kanrei (shogunate deputy of the northern regions [the former position of the Oshu Tandai who supervised for the civil government and military affairs in Mutsu Province]) from hisashi ban (a person who keeps the night watch staying under the eaves of building) of Imperial Prince Nariyoshi, and settled in Taga-jo Castle in Mutsu Province then became the key person for the Oshu rule of the Ashikaga Administration.

sen.j: その後、観応の擾乱が勃発すると直義方に属し、同じく奥州管領で尊氏方に与した畠山国氏 (奥州管領)を攻め滅ぼすが、その隙に勢力を伸張してきた南朝の北畠顕信に多賀城を攻め落とされる。
sen.e: When the Kanno Disturbance broke out, Sadaie belonged to Tadayoshi side and conquered Oshu Kanrei (Shogunal deputy of the northern regions) Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA who took part in Takauji side, Taga-jo Castle was taken by Akinobu KITABATAKE of the Southern Court, and he extended power during the chance absence of Sadaie.

Later, when the Kanno Disturbance broke out, Sadaie supported Tadayoshi side and conquered Oshu Kanrei (Shogunal deputy of the northern regions) Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA who took part in Takauji side, but Taga-jo Castle was attacked and defeated by Akinobu KITABATAKE of the Southern Court, who extended his power during the opportunity.
sen.cmt: Later, but, his を補いました。belonged to→supported,taken→attacked and defeated,chance absence of Sadaie→opportunity と修正しました。
sen.e: Later, when the Kanno Disturbance broke out, Sadaie supported Tadayoshi side and conquered Oshu Kanrei (Shogunal deputy of the northern regions) Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA who took part in Takauji side, but Taga-jo Castle was attacked and defeated by Akinobu KITABATAKE of the Southern Court, who extended his power during the opportunity.

sen.j: 以後、再び勢力を回復して顕信に挑むも死去。
sen.e: Sadaie restored power once again, afterward during the challenge Akinobu, Sadaie died.
Sadaie restored his power once again and fought Akinobu, but died.
sen.cmt: his を補いました。文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Sadaie restored his power once again and fought Akinobu, but died.

sen.j: 子の満家が奥州管領となって、畠山国氏の子畠山国詮や奥州総大将石塔義房の子石塔義憲と争う。
sen.e: Sadaie's child, Mitsuie, became Oshu Kanrei and fought with Kuniakira HATAKEYAMA who was a child of Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA and Yoshinori ISHIDO who was a child of the supreme commander of Oshu, Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA.

Sadaie's child, Mitsuie, became Oshu Kanrei and fought with Kuniakira HATAKEYAMA who was a child of Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA and Yoshinori ISHIDO who was a child of the supreme commander of Oshu, Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA.

Sadaie's child, Mitsuie, became Oshu Kanrei and fought with Kuniakira HATAKEYAMA who was a child of Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA and Yoshinori ISHIDO who was a child of the supreme commander of Oshu, Kuniuji HATAKEYAMA.

sen.j: その間、中央で直義の殺害に成功した尊氏は、斯波家兼を新たな奥州管領として派遣したため、この斯波家兼が奥州における最有力となる。
sen.e: Meanwhile Takauji succeeded in the killing of Tadayoshi at the center of Japan, Iekane SHIBA was dispatched as new Oshu Kanrei, and thus Iekane SHIBA became most influential in Oshu.
Meanwhile, Takauji succeeded in killing Tadayoshi at the center of Japan, sent Iekane SHIBA as new Oshu Kanrei, thus Iekane SHIBA became the most influential person in Oshu.
sen.cmt: the, of, and を削除しました。was dispatched→sent と修正しました。カンマ、the, person を補いました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Takauji succeeded in killing Tadayoshi at the center of Japan, sent Iekane SHIBA as new Oshu Kanrei, thus Iekane SHIBA became the most influential person in Oshu.

sen.j: 満家の死後、子の持家が跡を継ぐが、幼少のため、貞家の弟貞経と貞家の子で満家の弟治家が争った。
sen.e: Mochiie, Mitsuie's child succeeded after his death, but Sadatsune who was a younger brother of Sadaie and Haruie a child of Sadaie and Mituie's brother had fought since Mochiie was young.
Mochiie, Mitsuie's child, succeeded after Mitsuie's death, but since Mochiie was too young, Sadatsune who was a younger brother of Sadaie, and Haruie, a child of Sadaie and Mituie's brother fought.
sen.cmt: his→Mitsuie,had を削除しました。too, カンマを補いました。オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: Mochiie, Mitsuie's child, succeeded after Mitsuie's death, but since Mochiie was too young, Sadatsune who was a younger brother of Sadaie, and Haruie, a child of Sadaie and Mituie's brother fought.

sen.j: 貞治6年（1367年）、足利義詮は斯波直持と吉良貞経を奥州管領として治家を追討するように命じ、さらに石橋棟義を派遣してきた。
sen.e: 1367, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA gave an order for Tadamochi SHIBA and Sadatsune KIRA as Oshu Kanrei to hunt down and kill Haruie, and Muneyoshi ISHIBASHI was also dispatched.
In 1367, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA gave an order that Tadamochi SHIBA and Sadatsune KIRA to be as Oshu Kanrei to hunt down and kill Haruie, and Muneyoshi ISHIBASHI was also dispatched.
sen.cmt: In を補いました。for→that と修正しました。to be を補いました。
sen.e: In 1367, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA gave an order that Tadamochi SHIBA and Sadatsune KIRA to be as Oshu Kanrei to hunt down and kill Haruie, and Muneyoshi ISHIBASHI was also dispatched.

sen.j: 治家は敗れ没落する。
sen.e: Haruie lost, and he fell.
Haruie lost, and he fell.
Haruie lost, and he fell.

sen.j: その後、奥州吉良氏は振るわず、衰退の一途を辿る。
sen.e: The Oshu Kira clan was not stirred up, chose not to act, afterwards their decline would follow.
After that, the Oshu Kira clan could not flourish and continued to decline.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: After that, the Oshu Kira clan could not flourish and continued to decline.

sen.j: 室町時代
sen.e: Muromachi Period (1333 - 1573)
Muromachi period
sen.cmt: Period→period と修正しました。カッコ部分を削除しました。
sen.e: Muromachi period

sen.j: 滅亡の危機に瀕した奥州吉良氏であるが、初代鎌倉公方の足利基氏から招かれた治家が上野国飽間郷に移住すると、徐々に勢力を回復し始める。
sen.e: Oshu Kira clan was on the verge of the extinction, but Haruie restored power slowly after Motouji ASHIKAGA of the first shogun of Kamakura invited him to relocate into Akima-go, Kozuke Province.

Oshu Kira clan was on the verge of the extinction, but Haruie restored power gradually after Motouji ASHIKAGA of the first Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region) invited him to relocate into Akima-go, Kozuke Province.

Oshu Kira clan was on the verge of the extinction, but Haruie restored power gradually after Motouji ASHIKAGA of the first Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region) invited him to relocate into Akima-go, Kozuke Province.

sen.j: 鎌倉公方家に仕えた奥州吉良氏は、公方と同じ足利氏の流れを汲む家として「鎌倉公方の御一家」という別格の扱いを受けた。
sen.e: The Oshu Kira clan served the Kamakura kubo (shogunate) family and was treated with the special rank of "goikke (head and branch family of Ashikaga) of Kamakura kubo" as the family which descended from the Ashikaga clan was being the same as a Shogun family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Oshu Kira clan, served the Kamakura kubo family, was treated with the special rank of 'goikke (head and branch family of Ashikaga) of Kamakura kubo' as the family which descended from the Ashikaga clan, same as kubo (shogunal representative).
sen.cmt: (shogunate) を削除しました。引用符を修正しました。「公方」を修正しました。スムースに修正しました。"「足利御一家衆」「無御盃衆」と称された。"の部分は後列に移動済みのため、削除しました。
sen.e: The Oshu Kira clan, served the Kamakura kubo family, was treated with the special rank of 'goikke (head and branch family of Ashikaga) of Kamakura kubo' as the family which descended from the Ashikaga clan, same as kubo (shogunal representative).

sen.j: 「足利御一家衆」「無御盃衆」と称された。
sen.e: It was to be called "Ashikaga goikke-shu (troop of head and branch family of Ashikaga)" and " mugyohai-shu."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was called 'Ashikaga goikke-shu (troop of head and branch family of Ashikaga)' and 'mugyohai-shu.'
sen.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。to be を削除、引用符を修正しました。
sen.e: It was called 'Ashikaga goikke-shu (troop of head and branch family of Ashikaga)' and 'mugyohai-shu.'

sen.j: 成高の代に武蔵国荏原郡世田谷（東京都世田谷区）に世田谷城を構え、同地に土着。
sen.e: In Shigetaka's days, he built the Setagaya-jo Castle and settled in Setagaya, Ebara County, Musashi Province (Setagaya Ward, Tokyo).
In Shigetaka's days, he built Setagaya-jo Castle and settled in Setagaya, Ebara County, Musashi Province (Setagaya Ward, Tokyo Metropolis).
sen.cmt: The を削除しました。Metropolis を補いました。
sen.e: In Shigetaka's days, he built Setagaya-jo Castle and settled in Setagaya, Ebara County, Musashi Province (Setagaya Ward, Tokyo Metropolis).

sen.j: 以降、拠点を変えるたびに「蒔田御所」、「世田谷御所」、「世田谷殿」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Following that, each time Shigetaka was to relocate his home ground; he was then called, "Maita-gosho", "Setagaya-gosho", and "Setagaya-dono."
After that, each time Shigetaka relocated his home ground, those were called, 'Maita-gosho,' 'Setagaya-gosho,' and 'Setagaya-dono.'
sen.cmt: Following→After,was to relocate→relocated,セミコロンをカンマに修正しました。引用符、カンマの位置を修正しました。”呼ばれた”のは彼ではなく拠点と理解し、修正しました。
sen.e: After that, each time Shigetaka relocated his home ground, those were called, 'Maita-gosho,' 'Setagaya-gosho,' and 'Setagaya-dono.'

sen.j: 戦国時代から安土桃山時代
sen.e: The Sengoku period to Azuchi-Momoyama period
The Sengoku Period to Azuchi-Momoyama period
The Sengoku Period to Azuchi-Momoyama period

sen.j: 関東の覇者となった後北条氏に取り込まれて傀儡化した古河公方とともに、こちらも政略結婚を通じて北条氏の傘下に入った。
sen.e: Since the hegemony of the Gohojo clan in Knato and surrounded Kogakubo (descendants of one of the Ashikaga families that held the office of the Kanto district administrator), Kogakubo became a puppet in the hands of the Gohojo clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Oshu Kira clan came under jurisdiction of the Hojo clan through a marriage of expediency, in the similar manner to the Kogakubo, coaxed and became a puppet player of the Gohojo clan who had become the ruler of the Kanto region.
sen.cmt: ウェブ上のものと照らし合わせてみた上で、この場合は一括の方が意味が通りやすいと判断し、一括とし、修正しました。重複する部分の後列のオリジナルは削除しました。
sen.e: The Oshu Kira clan came under jurisdiction of the Hojo clan through a marriage of expediency, in the similar manner to the Kogakubo, coaxed and became a puppet player of the Gohojo clan who had become the ruler of the Kanto region.

sen.j: 成高の子頼康は北条氏綱の娘と結婚し、武蔵国久良岐郡蒔田（神奈川県横浜市南区 (横浜市)）をも領して「蒔田殿」と呼ばれ、後北条氏分国内に在りながら独自の印判状を用いることを許された。
sen.e: A child of Shigetaka, Yoriyasu, was called "Maita-dono" after marrying a daughter of Ujitsuna HOJO and possessed Maita, Kuraki County, Musashi Province and Minami Ward, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture (Yokohama City) Maita-dono was permitted to use the Inban-jo (license with a seal) while he was residing in Gohojo clan's province that was occupied by shugo daimyo or sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period.

A child of Shigetaka, Yoriyasu, was called 'Maita-dono' after marrying a daughter of Ujitsuna HOJO and owing Maita, Kuraki County, Musashi Province (Minami Ward, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture [Yokohama City]), and was permitted to use his own Inban-jo (license with a seal) although he was in the Gohojo clan's province.
sen.cmt: 引用符を修正しました。possessesd→owning,カッコを補い修正しました。文脈に応じて修正しました。that was occupied by shugo daimyo or sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period.の部分は不必要と思われ削除しました。
sen.e: A child of Shigetaka, Yoriyasu, was called 'Maita-dono' after marrying a daughter of Ujitsuna HOJO and owing Maita, Kuraki County, Musashi Province (Minami Ward, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture [Yokohama City]), and was permitted to use his own Inban-jo (license with a seal) although he was in the Gohojo clan's province.

sen.j: 頼康は堀越氏（今川氏の一族・遠江今川氏の直系）から氏朝を迎えて養子とし家督を譲る。
sen.e: Yoriyasu adopted Ujitom from the Horikoshi clan (a direct line to the Totomi-Imagawa clan) for the purpose of transferring the head of the family to him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Yoriyasu adopted Ujitomo from the Horikoshi clan (a direct line of the Totomi-Imagawa clan, a family of the Imagawa clan), for the purpose of passing the family estate to him.
sen.cmt: Ujitom→Ujitomo,カッコ内を修正しました。transferring→passing,head of the family→family estate と修正しました。
sen.e: Yoriyasu adopted Ujitomo from the Horikoshi clan (a direct line of the Totomi-Imagawa clan, a family of the Imagawa clan), for the purpose of passing the family estate to him.

sen.j: が、この氏朝の代に豊臣秀吉の小田原攻めによる後北条氏の滅亡に遭い、庇護者を失った。
sen.e: However, the Gohojo clan fell at the Invasion of Odawara by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during the Ujitomo's period, so Ujitomo lost his patron. Ujitomo went to his former territory of Setagaya to be confined there as a Roukyu (a person to forever remain at home, never to leave, a house arrest).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, the Gohojo clan fell at the invasion of Odawara by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during the Ujitomo's period, and Ujitomo lost his patron.
sen.cmt: Invasion→invasion,so→and と修正しました。後列と重複している部分は削除しました。
sen.e: However, the Gohojo clan fell at the invasion of Odawara by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during the Ujitomo's period, and Ujitomo lost his patron.

sen.j: 旧領世田谷に篭居する。
sen.e: Ujitomo went to his former territory of Setagaya to be confined there as a Roukyu (a person to forever remain at home, never to leave, a house arrest).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ujitomo shut himself in the former territory of Setagaya.
sen.cmt: 文後半の不要と思われる箇所を削除しました。（仕様指示書、”「新たな情報の追加」を避け、原文にある情報のみにとどめる”に従い）
sen.e: Ujitomo shut himself in the former territory of Setagaya.

sen.j: 江戸時代以降
sen.e: After the Edo period
After the Edo period
After the Edo period

sen.j: 徳川家康に従うようになると家格の高さを認められ、高家として取り立てられた。
sen.e: The Oshu Kira clan followed Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the high family ranking and status was acknowledged and designated ko-ke.
As the Oshu Kira clan followed Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the high family status was recognized and promoted to ko-ke.
sen.cmt: As を補いました。ranking and を削除、acknowledge→recognized,designated→promoted to と修正しました。
sen.e: As the Oshu Kira clan followed Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the high family status was recognized and promoted to ko-ke.

sen.j: この頃から、蒔田氏として正式に改称している。
sen.e: As of this time, the Oshu Kira clan would formally be renamed the Maita clan.
From this time, the Oshu Kira clan formally renamed themselves to the Maita clan.
sen.cmt: As of→From と修正、 would, be を削除、themselves, to を補いました。
sen.e: From this time, the Oshu Kira clan formally renamed themselves to the Maita clan.

sen.j: これは、今川氏庶流で知られる品川氏と同様の理由が考えられている。
sen.e: As for this justification, it seemingly applied to the same reasons present in the situation of the Shinagawa clan as the Imagawa clan family branch.
This is thought to be for the same reason as the Shinagawa clan, known as a branch family of the Imagawa clan.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: This is thought to be for the same reason as the Shinagawa clan, known as a branch family of the Imagawa clan.

sen.j: 江戸中期では、元禄赤穂事件によって三河吉良氏が断絶したことを契機に、「吉良」に復姓した。
sen.e: In the middle of the Edo period, the Mikawa-Kira clan ended their family line during the Genroku Ako Incident, and Oshu Kira clan rose from this opportunity to return their family name to "Kira".
In the middle of the Edo period, the Mikawa-Kira clan ended their family line by the Genroku Ako Incident, and the Oshu Kira clan took this opportunity to retrieve their family name 'Kira.'
sen.cmt: during→by,rose from→took,return→retrieve と修正しました。the を補い、to を削除、引用符を修正しました。
sen.e: In the middle of the Edo period, the Mikawa-Kira clan ended their family line by the Genroku Ako Incident, and the Oshu Kira clan took this opportunity to retrieve their family name 'Kira.'

sen.j: なお、豪徳寺とは、一族の吉良政忠が世田谷城の域内に創建した弘徳院が前身である。
sen.e: In addition, the Gotokuji Temple was formally established as the Kotoku-in Temple, which was built inside of Setagaya-jo Castle by Masatada KIRA from Oshu Kira clan family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition, the Gotoku-ji Temple is formally established as the Kotoku-in Temple, which was built within the premises of Setagaya-jo Castle, by Masatada KIRA from Oshu Kira clan family.
sen.cmt: Gotokuji→Gotoku-ji,was→is,inside→within the premises と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: In addition, the Gotoku-ji Temple is formally established as the Kotoku-in Temple, which was built within the premises of Setagaya-jo Castle, by Masatada KIRA from Oshu Kira clan family.

sen.j: 寺内には吉良一族の墓を見ることができる。
sen.e: We can see graves of Kira clan family inside Gotokuji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: We can see graves of Kira family in the site of Gotoku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: clan を削除しました。inside→in the premises of,Gotokuji→Gotoku-ji と修正しました。
sen.e: We can see graves of Kira family in the site of Gotoku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 明治に至り、知行地であった千葉県長生郡寺崎に移っている。
sen.e: To the Meiji period, the Kira clan family relocated to the lands of their chigyo-chi (a land given to a feudal load or a samurai as an annual stipend): Terasaki, Chosei County, and Chiba Prefecture.
In the Meiji period, the Kira family relocated to the lands of their chigyo-chi (a land given to a feudal load or a samurai as an annual stipend): Terasaki, Chosei County, and Chiba Prefecture.
sen.cmt: To→In と修正しました。clan を削除しました。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, the Kira family relocated to the lands of their chigyo-chi (a land given to a feudal load or a samurai as an annual stipend): Terasaki, Chosei County, and Chiba Prefecture.

sen.j: 本姓は源氏。
sen.e: The real family name is Genji.
The original family name is the Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: real→original,Genji→the Minamoto clan と修正しました。
sen.e: The original family name is the Minamoto clan.

sen.j: 家系は清和源氏の一家系河内源氏の棟梁源義朝の五男にて、源頼朝の同母弟源希義を祖とする。
sen.e: The family was descended from MINAMOTO no Mareyoshi, the fifth son of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo who was the leader of samurai family which came from Seiwa-Genji; tis family was descended from MINAMOTO no Mareyoshi who was a biological younger brother to MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

The family was descended from MINAMOTO no Mareyoshi, the fifth son of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo who was the leader of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), a family line of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan), and a younger maternal half-brother of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: 文半ば以降、文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: The family was descended from MINAMOTO no Mareyoshi, the fifth son of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo who was the leader of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), a family line of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan), and a younger maternal half-brother of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

sen.j: 希義の次男希望が、頼朝より土佐国吉良荘（高知県高知市春野町）を賜り、「吉良八郎」を称したことに始まる（一説には希義の長男隆盛の系統ともいう）。
sen.e: Maremochi, the second son of MINAMOTO no Mareyoshi, was given Kiranosho, Tosa Province (Haruno-cho, Kochi City, Kochi Prefecture) by Yoritomo, and then commenced calling himself, "Hachiro KIRA"; this became the starting point of their family establishment (In another study, the family was descended from Takamor, the first son of MINAMOTO no Mareyoshi.).

Maremochi, the second son of Mareyoshi, was given Kiranosho, Tosa Province (Haruno-cho, Kochi City, Kochi Prefecture) by Yoritomo, and then commenced calling himself, 'Hachiro KIRA,' this is the origin of their family establishment (In another study, the family was descended from Takamori, the first son of Mareyoshi.)
sen.cmt: MINANOTO no を削除しました。this became the starting point→this is the origin,Takamor→Takamori と修正しました。引用符、カンマの位置、ピリオドを修正しました。
sen.e: Maremochi, the second son of Mareyoshi, was given Kiranosho, Tosa Province (Haruno-cho, Kochi City, Kochi Prefecture) by Yoritomo, and then commenced calling himself, 'Hachiro KIRA,' this is the origin of their family establishment (In another study, the family was descended from Takamori, the first son of Mareyoshi.)

sen.j: 鎌倉時代は北条氏の被官的存在だったが、希望より六代後の希世・希秀兄弟が後醍醐天皇に仕えた。
sen.e: The Kira clan existed to serve the Gohojo clan as a hikan (low-level bureaucrat) during the Kamakura period, Mareyoshi and Marehide who were brothers six generation removed from Maremochi who had served Emperor Godaigo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Kira clan was hikan (low-level bureaucrat) to serve the Gohojo clan during the Kamakura period, but Mareyoshi and Marehide, who were the brothers of the sixth generation after Maremochi, served the Emperor Godaigo.
sen.cmt: but, カンマを補いました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: The Kira clan was hikan (low-level bureaucrat) to serve the Gohojo clan during the Kamakura period, but Mareyoshi and Marehide, who were the brothers of the sixth generation after Maremochi, served the Emperor Godaigo.

sen.j: 元弘の乱における六波羅探題攻略に功があった。
sen.e: These brothers succeeded in merit through conquer of Rokuhara Tandai during The Genko War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: These brothers succeeded on merit through the conquering Rokuhara Tandai at The Genko War.
sen.cmt: in→on,conquer→the conquering,during→at と修正しました。of を削除しました。
sen.e: These brothers succeeded on merit through the conquering Rokuhara Tandai at The Genko War.

sen.j: 以降しばらく、四国における南朝方の雄として、伊予国の河野氏らと行動をともにする。
sen.e: After that, the Kira clan gained recognition of the leader of the Shikoku region and accompanied the Kono clan of Iyo Province for a while.
After that, the Kira clan gained recognition as a leader of the Southern Court side in Shikoku region, and accompanied the Kono clan of Iyo Province for a while.
sen.cmt: of the→as a,「南朝方」を補いました。
sen.e: After that, the Kira clan gained recognition as a leader of the Southern Court side in Shikoku region, and accompanied the Kono clan of Iyo Province for a while.

sen.j: しかし希秀の子希雄が土佐守護細川氏の傘下に走って以降は北朝 (日本)方となる。
sen.e: However, Maretake, a child of Marehide, belonged to the Northern Court side after he ran in affiliation to the Hosokawa clan who was a shugo of Tosa Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, the clan became a part of the Northern Court (Japan) side, after that Maretake, a child of Marehide, decided to affiliate with the Hosokawa clan who was the shugo of Tosa Province.
sen.cmt: 「希雄」の読みは不明です。文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: However, the clan became a part of the Northern Court (Japan) side, after that Maretake, a child of Marehide, decided to affiliate with the Hosokawa clan who was the shugo of Tosa Province.

sen.j: 南朝方の篭る大高坂城（現在の高知城）の攻撃に参加するなどしている。
sen.e: Afterward the Kira clan participated in an attack on Otakasaka-jo Castle (presently, Kochi-jo Castle) where people of the Northern Court side were confined.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Kira clan participated in an attack on Otakasaka-jo Castle (present Kochi-jo Castle), in where people of the Southern Court side were barricading themselves, and so forth.
sen.cmt: Afterward を削除しました。where→in where,カッコ内を修正しました。 Northern→Southern,confined→barricading themselves と修正しました。and so forth を補いました。
sen.e: The Kira clan participated in an attack on Otakasaka-jo Castle (present Kochi-jo Castle), in where people of the Southern Court side were barricading themselves, and so forth.

sen.j: 応仁・文明 (日本)期には、宣通が細川勝元の将として上洛、応仁の乱においてそれなりの軍功を立てたという。
sen.e: Through Onin era to Bunmei era, Nobumichi served Katsumoto HOSOKAW as a commander and went to Kyoto. Nobumichi succeeded at distinguishing himself during military service in the Onin war.
Through the Onin era to the Bunmei era, Nobumichi served Katsumoto HOSOKAWA as a commander and went to Kyoto, Nobumichi succeeded to distinguish himself during the military service in the Onin War.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。HOSOKAW→HOSOKAWA,war→War,at distinguishing→to distinguish,ピリオドをカンマに修正しました。
sen.e: Through the Onin era to the Bunmei era, Nobumichi served Katsumoto HOSOKAWA as a commander and went to Kyoto, Nobumichi succeeded to distinguish himself during the military service in the Onin War.

sen.j: 宣忠の時、本山氏、大平、山田などの諸族とともに長宗我部兼序を攻め滅ぼし、勢力を拡大する。
sen.e: In Nobutada's days with Motoyama and Ohira clans, the Kira clan conquered Kanetsugu CHOSOKABE and Nobutada expanded their power.
In Nobutada's days, with the Motoyama clan and the Ohira clan, the Yamada clan so on, the Kira clan conquered Kanetsugu CHOSOKABE and expanded their power.
sen.cmt: カンマ、the, and so on を補いました。 「山田」を補いました。Nobutada を削除しました。
sen.e: In Nobutada's days, with the Motoyama clan and the Ohira clan, the Yamada clan so on, the Kira clan conquered Kanetsugu CHOSOKABE and expanded their power.

sen.j: 細川氏が力を失った後の土佐においては土佐一条氏を奉じ、宣経の時に一条氏から伊予国守に任ぜられた。
sen.e: After the Hosokawa clan lost power in Tosa Province, the Kira clan obeyed the Tosa Ichijo clan, and Nobutsune was assigned to Iyo no kuni no kami (Governor of Iyo Province) by the Ichijo clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the Hosokawa clan lost its power in Tosa Province, the Kira clan obeyed the Tosa Ichijo clan, and assigned to Iyo no kuni no kami (Governor of Iyo Province) by the Ichijo clan when the era of Nobutsune.
sen.cmt: its,the era of を補い修正しました。
sen.e: After the Hosokawa clan lost its power in Tosa Province, the Kira clan obeyed the Tosa Ichijo clan, and assigned to Iyo no kuni no kami (Governor of Iyo Province) by the Ichijo clan when the era of Nobutsune.

sen.j: 最盛期を迎えた。
sen.e: The Kira clan achieved prosperity during the days of Nobutsune.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Kira clan achieved the height of prosperity at this time.
sen.cmt: よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: The Kira clan achieved the height of prosperity at this time.

sen.j: 宣経は天文年間に周防国から宋学の第一人者・南村梅軒を招きいれ、土佐南学の基礎を築いた。
sen.e: Nobutsune invited the leading expert of Sogaku (Neo-Confucianism), Baikan MINAMIMURA, from Suo Province, and then laid the foundation of Tosa Nangaku (neo-Confucianism learned in Tosa).
Nobutsune invited the leading expert of Sogaku (Neo-Confucianism), Baikan MINAMIMURA, from Suo Province, and then established the foundation of Tosa Nangaku (neo-Confucianism learned in Tosa).
Nobutsune invited the leading expert of Sogaku (Neo-Confucianism), Baikan MINAMIMURA, from Suo Province, and then established the foundation of Tosa Nangaku (neo-Confucianism learned in Tosa).

sen.j: 宣経の死去後家督を継いだ宣直の頃、土佐中央部に進出してきた本山氏と土佐西部の土佐一条氏に挟まれた状況を打開するため一条氏と結んだ。
sen.e: Nobunao became a successor after Nobutsune's death, and he joined with the Ichijo clan to break the situation in being sandwiched between two clans in the Tosa region; the Motoyama clan which had expanded power in the center part and the Tosa Ichijo clan in the west part.

Around the time of Nobunao who succeeded the family estate after Nobutsune's death, joined the Ichijo clan to break the situation in being caught between the two clans; the Motoyama clan which had expanded power to the center part and the Tosa Ichijo clan in the west part.
sen.cmt: Around the time of を補いました。became a successor→who succeeded the family estate,sandwiched→caught と修正しました。and he を削除、後半部分を文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Around the time of Nobunao who succeeded the family estate after Nobutsune's death, joined the Ichijo clan to break the situation in being caught between the two clans; the Motoyama clan which had expanded power to the center part and the Tosa Ichijo clan in the west part.

sen.j: 天文 (日本)9年（1540年）本山茂辰は宣直が仁淀川に狩猟に出かけた隙を狙い、吉良城を落城させ、仁淀川にて宣直を討ち取る。
sen.e: In 1540, Shigetoki MOTOYAMA took a chance for the attack and surrender of the Kira-jo Castle when Nobunao was away from the castle hunting at the Niyodo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1540, Shigetoki MOTOYAMA took a chance to attack the Kira-jo Castle while Nobunao was away from the castle hunting at the Niyodo-gawa River, made the Kira-jo Castle surrender, and killed Nobunao at the Niyodo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: ウェブ上のものと照らし合わせてみた上で、この場合は一括の方が意味が通りやすいと判断し、一括とし、修正しました。重複する部分の後列のオリジナルは削除しました。
sen.e: In 1540, Shigetoki MOTOYAMA took a chance to attack the Kira-jo Castle while Nobunao was away from the castle hunting at the Niyodo-gawa River, made the Kira-jo Castle surrender, and killed Nobunao at the Niyodo-gawa River.

sen.j: ここに源姓土佐吉良氏は滅亡する。
sen.e: This led to the fall of the Tosa-Kira clan of the Minamoto family.
This led to the fall of the Tosa-Kira clan of the Minamoto family.
This led to the fall of the Tosa-Kira clan of the Minamoto family.

sen.j: 吉良城を落とした本山茂辰は、土佐において名族であった吉良姓を称することとなる。
sen.e: Shigetoki MOTOYAMA forced the surrender of the Kira-jo Castle, then asummed the Kira family name, since it was a noble family in Tosa.
Shigetoki MOTOYAMA who forced the surrender of the Kira-jo Castle, then came to take the name of Kira, which was a noble family in Tosa.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Shigetoki MOTOYAMA who forced the surrender of the Kira-jo Castle, then came to take the name of Kira, which was a noble family in Tosa.

sen.j: この他吉良氏滅亡には諸説あり、『吉良物語』においては永禄六年(1563年)に長宗我部氏に攻められ滅亡したとされる。
sen.e: In addition, there are various opinions for the Kira clan extinction, it is said that the Kira clan was attacked and fell to the Chosokabe in 1563 according to "Kira Monogatari (the Tale of Kira)."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition, there are various theories for the Kira clan's extinction, it is said that the Kira clan was attacked and fell by the Chosokabe clan in 1563, according to "Kira Monogatari" (the Tale of Kira).
sen.cmt: opinions→theories,clan→clan's,to→by と修正しました。clan, the, カンマを補いました。引用符を修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, there are various theories for the Kira clan's extinction, it is said that the Kira clan was attacked and fell by the Chosokabe clan in 1563, according to "Kira Monogatari" (the Tale of Kira).

sen.j: 他に永禄5年（1562年）に本山氏に攻められ滅亡したとする説もあるが、資料や本山茂辰の吉良姓僭称から信憑性は薄い。
sen.e: Another opinion suggests the Kira clan was attacked and fell to the Motoyama clan, but that information was not trustworthy because other literature and presentation of Kira name by Shigetoki MOTOYAMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Another theory suggests that the Kira clan was attacked and fell by the Motoyama clan, but the credibility is low due to Shigetoki MOTOYAMA's pretension of the Kira clan and from the other documents.
sen.cmt: opinions→theory, to→by,that を補いました。but 以降を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Another theory suggests that the Kira clan was attacked and fell by the Motoyama clan, but the credibility is low due to Shigetoki MOTOYAMA's pretension of the Kira clan and from the other documents.

sen.j: 永禄末年頃、本山氏を降した長宗我部元親は、自らの実弟にして宣直の女婿である親貞をして吉良氏の名跡を継がせた。
sen.e: At the end of Eiroku era (1558-1570), after defeating the Motoyama clan, Motochika CHOSOKABE let his biological younger brother and Nobunao's son-in-law, Chikasada, succeed to the family name of Kira.

Around the end of Eiroku era (1558-1570), after defeating the Motoyama clan, Motochika CHOSOKABE let his biological younger brother and Nobunao's son-in-law, Chikasada, succeed to the family name of Kira.

Around the end of Eiroku era (1558-1570), after defeating the Motoyama clan, Motochika CHOSOKABE let his biological younger brother and Nobunao's son-in-law, Chikasada, succeed to the family name of Kira.

sen.j: 親貞は一門の実力者としてよく元親を補佐したが、その子親実が謀叛の嫌疑を受けて殺されした。
sen.e: Chikasada assisted Motochika as an influential person to the family, but his child Chikazane, was killed in receipt of suspicion for rebellious acts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Chikasada assisted Motochika as an influential person of the family, but his child Chikazane, was killed on suspicion for a rebellious act.
sen.cmt: to→of, in→on,acts→act と修正しました。 a を補いました。receipt of を削除しました。
sen.e: Chikasada assisted Motochika as an influential person of the family, but his child Chikazane, was killed on suspicion for a rebellious act.

sen.j: 長宗我部氏支族としての土佐吉良氏も二代で滅亡した。
sen.e: Thus, a branch in the family of the Chosokabe clan referred to as the Tosa-Kira clan, survived for only two generations, and then fell.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thus, the Tosa-Kira clan, as a branch family of the Chosokabe clan, survived for only two generations, and then fell.
sen.cmt: a branch in the family→a branch family, スムースに修正しました。
sen.e: Thus, the Tosa-Kira clan, as a branch family of the Chosokabe clan, survived for only two generations, and then fell.
